com.example.sulemaia.Helper

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.sulemaia.Helper.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends Object
    Class for the correct parsing of the txt that the user tries to load into de app.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidStringInFile

        public static int isValidStringInFile(String fileContent)
        We receive a whole document (whichever the user chooses, so be careful with this; it means this can load anything, like photos or documents, but is only intended to load incredibly light txt files that go along the project specifications. This includes too many columns, rows, data amount inconsistency, or directly invalid content.
        Parameters:
        fileContent - The whole file that was actually selected by the user.
        Returns:
        any code that represent either a failure or a correct archive.

      • getFileArray

        public static int[][] getFileArray(String fileDataUnFiltered)
        Get every number into an array, to process later on.
        Parameters:
        fileDataUnFiltered - the raw file to upload to the program, that should have any errors, since those are looked for in the parsing method.
        Returns:
        the map values (numeric codes) of the read txt file.

      • getLetterForInt

        public static String getLetterForInt(int j)
        Method to return a letter based on a code to create the first row in the map.
        Parameters:
        j - the position on the alphabet.
        Returns:
        either a blank space (for the fist row - which relates to the first column and shouldnt have anythin) or the corresponding letter.

      • getTextSizeForMap

        public static float getTextSizeForMap(int length)
        Method to adapt the sizes of the map depending on how many tiles the map has.
        Parameters:
        length - a base length to process the new calculation.
        Returns:
        the maxSize.
